results.title: Whazzat?
results.creator_credit: Todd Delerman, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Art Pierson
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the East Indian folktale about six blind men who come upon an elephant and attempt to describe it. When each meets and touches the elephant he thinks he has encountered something different. Stresses the moral that cooperating with others can achieve more than working alone. For primary grades.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Todd Delerman, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Art Pierson

results.title: Whatever Happened to the Murray River?
results.brief_description: The film traces the history of the exploitation of the Murray River and shows the environmental consequences.

results.title: Whatever Happened to Childhood?
results.brief_description: Childhood as today’s adults knew it no longer exists. Early exposure to the pressures of drug usage and changing sexual morality, along with a new indifference to, and participation in, criminal behaviour is forcing our children into becoming adults at a younger age. Both young people and adults tell their stories and explore our changing society.

results.title: What we do at kindergarten
results.creator_credit: Myles-Milwright Productions, Dianne Milwright, Donn Clauscen and Pamela Eagles
results.brief_description: Shows daily activities in kindergartens emphasising the extent activities aid the preschool child’s development. Suitable for use with parents of kindergarten age children and for infant primary teachers as a background knowledge of what happens in kindergartens.

results.title: What to eat
results.creator_credit: Terry Trench, Derek Stewart Productions and Gerard Bryant
results.brief_description: An outline of the basic principles of nutrition. Diagrams and live action describe the nutritional value of various foods and the requirements of the body for a balanced diet of calories and vitamins. The wide choice of consumer hoods available in Britain today permits a sensible diet for all.

results.title: What to do when I'm dead
results.brief_description: Beginning from the initial reactions of doubt and confusion, then moving on to remembrance, this short program follows the experiences of a brother and sister as they deal with the death of their mother who leaves them the document - “what to do when I’m dead”. The proceedings of the final day are followed as family and friends gather from near and far to share their pain. The video explores issues such as dying and funeral ceremonies at home, grieving with minimal intervention, different reactions to grief and how ‘outsiders’ affect family dynamics. Cast includes Jennifer Kent, Josh Quong Tart, Shane Porteous and Celia Ireland.

results.title: What time is it in Tokyo?
results.brief_description: Uses the principles relating to the rotation of the earth and its position in relation to the sun to explain why there are time differences around the world and how these effect us.
